title: Breather for Corporates: MCA Extends Annual Filing Deadline for FY 2024-25 to January 31, 2026, Sans Additional Fees!
content:
# Breather for Corporates: MCA Extends Annual Filing Deadline for FY 2024-25 to January 31, 2026, Sans Additional Fees!

As professionals in the corporate compliance world, we all know the year-end rush and the anxiety that comes with looming statutory deadlines. Just when many of us were bracing for the final push to meet the December 31st deadline for annual filings, the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) has once again stepped in, offering a much-needed sigh of relief. The MCA, through its **General Circular No. 08/2025 dated December 30, 2025**, has extended the due date for annual filings for the Financial Year 2024-25 without additional fees until **January 31, 2026**.

*Phew!* Didn't we all need this extra window? Let's dive deep into what this extension means for companies and professionals across India.

## The Much-Awaited Extension: What's Changed?

This isn't the first time the MCA has shown flexibility. Earlier, vide General Circular No. 06/2025 dated October 17, 2025, companies were granted a one-time relaxation to file their annual forms for FY 2024-25 without incurring additional fees up to December 31, 2025. Now, in a further continuation of that relief, the deadline has been pushed by another month.

The key takeaway is straightforward: Companies can now file their financial statements and annual returns for the financial year ended March 31, 2025, till **January 31, 2026**, and this will be considered a timely filing, attracting **no additional fees**.

### Forms Covered Under This Relaxation

This extension is applicable to the following crucial e-Forms, which are central to a company's annual compliance obligations under the Companies Act, 2013:

*   **Financial Statements:**
    *   **Form AOC-4** (for filing financial statements)
    *   **Form AOC-4 CFS** (for consolidated financial statements)
    *   **Form AOC-4 NBFC (Ind AS)** (for NBFCs applying Ind AS)
    *   **Form AOC-4 CFS NBFC (Ind AS)** (for consolidated financial statements of NBFCs applying Ind AS)
    *   **Form AOC-4 (XBRL)** (for XBRL filings)
*   **Annual Returns:**
    *   **Form MGT-7** (for filing annual return by companies having share capital)
    *   **Form MGT-7A** (for filing annual return by One Person Company (OPC) and Small Company)

It's important to remember that all other conditions and requirements stipulated in the previous General Circular No. 06/2025 remain unchanged.

## Why This Extension, Ab Iski Kya Zaroorat Thi?

The MCA's decision to extend the deadline stems directly from the representations received from various stakeholders. We’ve all seen the social media chatter, haven't we? Many professionals and companies were flagging persistent technical glitches, frequent timeouts, and other system-related issues on the MCA portal while attempting to complete their filings.

Such technical hiccups, especially during peak filing periods, can severely impede compliance efforts, leading to unnecessary penalties for genuine attempts at timely adherence. This extension reflects the MCA's understanding of these practical difficulties and its intent to reduce compliance pressure, encourage voluntary compliance, and ultimately avoid penal consequences for procedural delays caused by external factors. It’s a pragmatic move to ensure ease of doing business, even if it's a bit of a last-minute push.

## Old vs. New Provision: A Quick Glance

To put it in perspective, here’s a comparison:

| Aspect                                                    | Old Provision (as per Circular 06/2025)        | New Provision (as per Circular 08/2025)       |
| :-------------------------------------------------------- | :--------------------------------------------- | :-------------------------------------------- |
| **Annual Filing Deadline FY 2024-25 (without additional fees)** | Up to December 31, 2025         | **Up to January 31, 2026**       |
| **Forms Covered**                                         | MGT-7, MGT-7A, AOC-4, AOC-4 CFS, AOC-4 NBFC (Ind AS), AOC-4 CFS NBFC (Ind AS), AOC-4 (XBRL) | Same forms                       |
| **AGM Deadline Impact**                                   | Unchanged                                      | **Unchanged**                       |

## Implications for Companies and Professionals

This extension is a welcome relief for numerous companies that might have been struggling with finalising their accounts or facing challenges with the filing portal. It provides an additional month to:

*   **Ensure Accuracy:** More time means a thorough review, reducing the chances of errors in financial statements and annual returns.
*   **Alleviate Pressure:** The immediate pressure of the December 31st deadline is lifted, allowing professionals to work systematically.
*   **Avoid Penalties:** Most importantly, companies can avoid additional fees and other penal consequences that would have otherwise kicked in from January 1, 2026.

However, a critical point to remember is that while the filing deadline for forms has been extended, this circular **does not provide any extension for holding Annual General Meetings (AGMs)**. Companies must ensure they comply with the AGM timelines as prescribed under the Companies Act, 2013. Yeh rule ab applicable nahi hai ki filing deadline ke saath AGM ki date bhi extend ho gayi!

## Key Takeaways for FY 2024-25 Filings

So, what’s the bottom line? This extension is a golden opportunity to get your compliance in order without the burden of additional fees. Utilise this extended window wisely. Don't wait until the last minute again, because **filings made after January 31, 2026, will definitively attract additional fees** and other consequences as per the Companies Act, 2013.

As compliance professionals, our role now is to guide our clients to make the most of this extension and ensure their filings are accurate, complete, and submitted well before the new January 31, 2026, deadline. Happy filing!
